How can I use the `listsinceblock` command to list transactions since a specific block using the command line?

You can use the `listsinceblock` command by specifying the block hash and the number of confirmations as arguments. For example:

```
verus listsinceblock "000000000000000bacf66f7497b7dc45ef753ee9a7d38571037cdb1a57f663ad" 6
```

This command will list transactions since the block with the specified hash and with at least 6 confirmations.

Examples:
> verus listsinceblock 
> verus listsinceblock "000000000000000bacf66f7497b7dc45ef753ee9a7d38571037cdb1a57f663ad" 6
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listsinceblock", "params": ["000000000000000bacf66f7497b7dc45ef753ee9a7d38571037cdb1a57f663ad", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
